</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4PT; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-TOP: 0IN; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="126">
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>
<BR>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 20 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The exploration licences at TJS are defined by latitude and longitude and marked on either the No. 3&deg; or No. 6&deg; Qinghai Provincial Grid. The tenements are not surveyed, and the co-ordinate definition on the maps takes precedence over all other definitions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Owners of an exploration license have the right to explore for all minerals, save those preserved for the State, and to construct such facilities as required by the owner for exploration. The owner also has a priority claim over applications for mining licences within the exploration licence area. Owners are obligated to begin and complete exploration within the time frame of the licence and to submit
	progress reports on a regular basis. Excavations and other surface disturbances are required to be rehabilitated on completion of the planned exploration. Annual maintenance costs are RMB 100 per km
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	for years 1 to 3, thereafter increasing by RMB 100 per year to a maximum of RMB 500 per km
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	per year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Prescribed exploration expenditures per km
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	are RMB 2,000 in year 1, RMB 5,000 in year 2 and RMB 10,000 in subsequent years. These licenses are granted initially for three years, and may be extended for a further two years. There is no limit to the number of extensions that may be applied for. The mining license is granted for a maximum initial period of three years depending on the scale of
	the mine; thereafter, renewal is reviewed before expiration upon the mining license holder&rsquo;s application. Renewal is guaranteed, provided there is compliance with mining regulations and all tax and royalty payments have been made. Owners of a mining licence have the right to construct, develop and mine the delineated mineral resource.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Currently, the JLG mining license is owned by QDML and extends from surface (3,556 masl) to 3,378 masl. This license was subsequently upgraded to include all mineral resources down to 3,000 masl, an elevation below the existing known resources.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The QLT mining license, previously held by Q1, was transferred to QDML. This mining license extends vertically from surface (3,710 masl) to 3,450 masl.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Surface rights at TJS are currently sufficient for mining operations at the scale indicated by the Tanjianshan proven and probable reserves, as disclosed under &ldquo;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Description of the Business &ndash; Summary Review &ndash; Mineral Reserves and Mineral Resources
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	&rdquo;. To the extent that such proven and probable reserves increase, TJS surface rights
	will not be sufficient, and it will be necessary to obtain additional surface rights. There are three ways to obtain land use rights from the PRC government authorities: allocation, grant and lease. Different levels of government organizations have different authorities to approve the land use right application depending on the nature and areas of the land concerned. QDML may submit its application to the relevant government authorities to obtain the granted land or leased land if it
	deems necessary. QDML obtained the lease right dated July 11, 2005 under which QDML is entitled to use the leased land with an area of 445,100 m
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	. On February 1, 2007 QDML obtained a Phase 2 lease right under which QDML is entitled to use additional leased land with an area of 221,083 m
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	. On February 1
<SUP>
	st
</SUP>
	, 2007, Phase 3 was also obtained under which QDML is entitled to use an additional 111,661 m
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	of additional leased land. Phase 4 application
	is currently under way for another 2,642,573 m
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	of leased land. This lease is expected to be granted in the fourth quarter of 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	For the allocated land use right, the government may approve the allocated land use right in accordance with the Catalogue for Allocated Land, which lists certain industries that may be able to use allocated land. Although the gold mining industry has not been listed in the Catalogue for Allocated Land, QDML obtained allocated land on July 11, 2005 with an area of 243,332 m
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	. On February 1,
	2007 QDML obtained the allocated land under which QDML is entitled to use additional allocated land for an area of 1,170,654 m
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	. On February 1, 2007, QDML also obtained the allocated land under which QDML is entitled to additional allocated land for an area of 575,469 m
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	. The rules have subsequently changed and allocation is now only used for social projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Co-operative Joint Venture (the &ldquo;CJV&rdquo;) provides that Q1 and Dachaidan Gold Mine obtain a total of 4.5 percent of the net sales revenue from the gold produced by QDML as their base income directly transferred once each sale is transacted. This revenue shall be directly transferred to the account designated by each of Q1 and Dachaidan Gold Mine each time QDML sells mineral products. The 4.5
	percent royalty is evenly split between the two groups (2.25 percent each). However, in order for Q1 and Dachaidan Gold Mine to obtain such 4.5 percent royalty, approval from related tax authorities must be obtained. The royalty percentage is unaffected by the percentage ownership interests of the parties to the QDML joint venture. The total royalties paid to our QMDL partners in 2009 were approximately $4.2 million USD.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 21 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Location, Climate, Access and Infrastructure
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Tanjianshan is located in the Dachaidan Region, Haixi Prefecture, Qinghai Province in the northwest of the PRC. Qinghai is a relatively large province covering 720,000 km
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	and supporting a population of approximately 5.3 million. The capital of Qinghai is Xining, which is situated in the eastern part of the province. The project area is located 80 km northwest of Dachaidan in the Haixi
	Prefecture.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The camp and the mill site at Tanjianshan are located at an elevation of 3,200 m with the main resource at between 3,300 m and 3,550 m. Tanjianshan is located in the Saishiteng Mountains, and there is virtually no vegetation in the area. The landscape is composed of rugged mountains with slope angles of 45&deg; to 50&deg;. The Aolao River lies approximately two km to the east and is the only permanent
	river in the area.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The project area experiences a dry continental climate with low rainfall, high evaporation and generally clear skies. Winters are long and summers short, with a large daily variance in temperature range. Meteorological data collected between 1971 and 1980 at Dachaidan (80 km east southeast), and at a lower elevation than the site, recorded an average annual temperature of 1.6
<SUP>
	o
</SUP>
	C and annual
	rainfall of 200 mm. Maximum monthly temperatures are in July and August (21
<SUP>
	o
</SUP>
	C) and minimum monthly temperatures are in January (-15
<SUP>
	o
</SUP>
	C). Maximum monthly rainfall is in June and July (40 mm), whereas little or no precipitation is recorded in November, December and January. The highest temperature on record is 29.9
<SUP>
	o
</SUP>
	C on July 15, 1971 and the lowest is -32.3
<SUP>
	o
</SUP>
	C on January 18, 1973. Winds are frequent and strong from the west and northwest averaging
	8.6 km/h and peaking at 70 km/h.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The nearest centres are Dunhuang, Gansu Province (265 km by road to the north) and Ge&rsquo;ermu (260 km by road to the south). There are frequent flights during tourist season between Beijing and Dunhuang. There are also regular flights from Xining to Ge&rsquo;ermu throughout the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The site is easily accessed by road. There is a main highway between Dunhuang and Ge&rsquo;ermu or Dachaidan in Qinghai Province that passes within 12 km of the plant site. The road is sealed and in good condition, ensuring year-round access throughout the area. Annual electrical power requirements for Tanjianshan are approximately 8,000 kilowatts. A power line from Xitieshan provides sufficient
	electrical power to meet these requirements and is anticipated to also cover any increase in power demand in case of expansion. At the end of 2009, QDML had a workforce of 464 people at TJS.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Geology and Mineralization
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	JLG lies within a low, northwest trending, mountain range (Tanjianshan) composed of Proterozoic Wandonggou Group metamorphic rocks. Early Palaeozoic gabbro and Late Paleozoic porphyritic plagiogranite intruding these units. Northwest striking thrust faults dissect the units and commonly separate structural blocks. The range to the northwest, which is host to the QLT deposit, has the same mix of rocks but
	also includes a large block of Late Paleozoic granite.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The JLG gold deposit lies in a host rock sequence dominated by carbonaceous phyllites. The rocks are dark grey to black and display a well-developed foliation. Two intrusive rock types occur within the limits of the mineralization and are both of probable intermediate composition. Both intrusive unit types occur above and below a major gently-dipping fault/deformation zone (T2) fault but exhibit
	different geometric styles. Above T2, the intrusions occur as steep (60&deg;- 70&deg;) southwest dipping, southeast striking
<FONT SIZE="2">
	thin dykes that clearly cut across the folded sedimentary units. At deeper levels, intrusions are volumetrically more significant, and occur as multiple sheeted, near horizontal sills.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The JLG deposit occurs within a roughly bowl-shaped volume having about a 500-m diameter and extending up to 240&nbsp;m below surface. .Two geometrically distinct host environments exist for gold mineralization at Jinlonggou: at shallow levels, moderately to steeply dipping tabular zones are distributed within phyllite adjacent to faults and fracture zones, and at deeper levels, gently
	dipping mineralized zones are hosted within diorite and phyllite.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	QLT mineralization is confined to a 50-80&deg; east-dipping zone. The zone is typically 5 to 10 m wide, to a maximum of 14 m, and has been defined for 600 m along strike and over 300&nbsp;m down dip.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The QLT deposit was hosted within a distinctive white silty dolomitic unit. Gold is hosted within the pyrite and arsenopyrite crystals. Minor amounts occur within quartz grains enclosed in pyrite.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 22 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Previous Exploration and Drilling
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Eldorado drill core data currently supports approximately 60 percent of the Tanjianshan mineral resource and the remaining 40 percent relies on older data from campaigns conducted by previous owners. A comprehensive validation program, under the supervision of DevMin, was executed on these older data. Devmin concluded that these data are of sufficient quality to be included for use to estimate mineral
	resources at Tanjianshan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The earliest exploration work in the area was in the late 1950s when Qinghai No. 5 Exploration Brigade explored for petroleum. A comprehensive reconnaissance, prospect investigation and regional surveys started in the early 1970s with work undertaken mainly by Qinghai No. 5 and No. 6 Exploration Brigades, during which, a number of mineral prospects were discovered, including copper at Yixianshan, a
	pyrrhotite-pyrite prospect at Huanglushan, pyrite at QLT and limonite at Tanjianshan. Lode gold in the area was discovered in the late 1970s by the Qinghai No. 5 Exploration Brigade Geology Team at Zhishigou, and this discovery intensified gold exploration work along the Chaidamu Northern Margin tectonic zone. Gold was discovered at JLG during the course of uranium exploration in 1989 by Q1, following which limited mining of both that deposit and QLT was undertaken. At JLG, the Q1 team
	generated exploration data in 29 surface drilled core holes; completed underground development on three levels and accompanying raises and sub-levels; and conducted extensive surface sampling in trenches, shallow pits or shafts on section lines 30 m apart.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Recent Exploration
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The 2009 exploration program at TJS focused on drilling in and around the mined out QLT open pit deposit and on evaluating untested down dip and along strike southerly extensions of the host zone. The along strike extension to the south is concealed beneath alluvial cover, and was evaluated through extensive shallow Rotary Air Blast (&ldquo;RAB&rdquo;) drilling.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	On August 12, 2009 Eldorado issued a news release reporting the first three Reverse Circulation (&ldquo;RC&rdquo;) holes drilled into a newly discovered zone of mineralization beneath the alluvial cover. The zone was named 323 zone after the discovery hole, and it was further drilled throughout the remainder of 2009. On November 25
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	the company issued a follow up news release with diamond
	drilling results from the zone.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The 323 zone is located approximately 2 km South of the QLT open pit. Diamond drilling has confirmed that the mineralized zone demonstrates continuity over a 300m strike length and remains open to the north and south. The diamond drilling identified a number of high grade zones, including intervals of 15.5 m grading 15.79 g/t (QD143), 18.0m grading 4.53 g/t (QD165), and 9m grading 1.49 g/t (QD167). The
	mineralized zone plunges gently southward. High gold grades are spatially associated with a northwest striking fault, which may have focused mineralized fluids. The 323 zone shows a strong lithological and structural similarity to the QLT deposit. The host rocks vary from a fine grained dolomitic meta-siltstone to a meta-sandstone with fine grained disseminated and clotted pyrite, capped by carbonaceous phyllite. The high grade zones commonly contain a moderate to strong overprint of
	ankerite and dolomite. As of
<FONT SIZE="2">
	March 2010, 36 diamond drill holes have been completed and drilling is continuing to define the deposit to the north and south.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Sampling and Analysis and Data Verification
</FONT>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Quality control procedures were instigated at the outset of the field program, and routine monitoring remains an essential part of the program. Analysis for gold was done on sawn half core samples using fire assay (AA finish) on a 50 g charge. Standard reference materials, blank and field duplicate samples are inserted prior to shipment from the site to monitor the quality control of the
	assay data. In addition, about 10 percent of the samples were re-submitted for duplicate analysis at a second laboratory. These measures provided controls and checks on both accuracy and precision of the analyses.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Aspects of the field work such as survey and bulk density determinations were also checked. These were conducted by repeat measurements using different operators or different methods.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Historic data (pre-2004 and comprising about 30 percent of all data) were validated for use in mineral resource estimation. These data were validated by re-sampling underground adits and crosscuts, re-assaying drill core sample pulp material, reviewing collar and down hole survey data, and comparing database entries to source material (where available).
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 23 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The quality control programs and validation work demonstrated that the assay data were sufficiently accurate and precise, and that the database is sufficiently free of error to support mineral resource estimation of the JLG and QLT deposits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mineral Reserve and Mineral Resource Estimates
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	See &ldquo;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Description of Business &ndash; Summary Review - Mineral Reserve and Mineral Resources
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	&rdquo;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Development and Operations
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	From 1996 to 2002 mining and heap leach processing of mined materials occurred, but ceased upon execution of the CJV.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	All ore and waste are currently mined via conventional, open pit mining methods and using a mining contractor. The operation uses selective mining techniques to separate ore and waste. Waste dumps are located adjacent to the existing pits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The treatment plant flowsheet is based on material being fed into a ROM bin and through a single stage crushing circuit to a mill feed bin/stockpile. This bin/stockpile is then fed through a single stage SAG mill and a classification circuit. QLT material is then fed through a conventional CIL circuit and then the tailings are floated with the sulphide material removed for subsequent treatment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	JLG material is treated based on the sulphide content. If the sulphide level is low, the material is treated through a conventional CIL circuit. If the sulphide level is sufficiently high, the material is fed through a flotation circuit and then dewatered. The QLT and JLG flotation concentrate are then blended for an optimal sulphur grade before being fed to the two-stage roasting circuit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The calcine product from the roaster then passes through a regrind mill to break down agglomerates and is then leached in a CIL circuit. The roaster off-gas passes through a cooling/cleaning circuit, an arsenic recovery circuit, and an acid plant. The recovered sulphuric acid and arsenic trioxide are sold. For high sulphide JLG ore, if the remaining gold grade is high enough, the flotation tails can be
	leached through the CIL circuit. The gold loaded carbon is then removed from both CIL circuits for gold recovery by Zadra methods, and electrowinning. Gold dor&eacute; is produced at site.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Aolao River is the primary source of raw water, which is pumped to a tank located close to the plant and used to supply water to the plant and the process water tank. Potable water is supplied to the plant and camp sites from the raw water system through a water treatment system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The TMF (&ldquo;Tailings Management Facility&rdquo;) is a &ldquo;hill side tailings impoundment.&rdquo; The TMF has a maximum height of about 40 m and uses the downstream construction method to minimize risks associated with the TMF. The TMF has been designed as a &lsquo;nil discharge&rsquo; facility with all free water returned to the treatment plant during operation. The tailings impound is located
	approximately one kilometre downstream from the plant site. The tailings dam has been lined with an HDPE liner to ensure that there is minimal risk of spills or leakage.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The following is a record of project millstones since the CJV was initiated:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;

<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 24 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Operating and Capital Costs
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	An annual LOM mill production rate of 1.0 Mt per year (&ldquo;mtpa&rdquo;) of ore is projected for the remainder of the TJS mine life. This translates to an average daily milled production rate of 2,700 tpd. The total quantity of ore remaining is projected to be 6.1 Mt . A gold recovery of 87.8 percent is projected for remainder of the sulphide and oxide ore.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Approximately 974,000 tonnes of ore were milled in the twelve months ended December2009 at an average grade of 5.31 g/t, resulting in 105,610 ounces of gold produced at an average cash operating cost of $349 per ounce.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Tanjianshan Reports
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Tanjianshan is the subject of the following technical report: &ldquo;Tanjianshan Gold Project, China, Technical Report&rdquo; (dated September 2005, revised January 30, 2006 and effective September 2005, prepared for Eldorado by RSG Global. The qualified persons responsible for the preparation of the report are John Hearne, MAusIMM of RSG Global and Stephen Juras, Ph.D., P.Geo. of Eldorado.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The scientific and technical information is largely derived from Tanjianshan Report. The Tanjianshan Report is available at www.sedar.com under our name, and should be reviewed to put the preceding discussion in context. TJS is also subject to a prior report that was prepared for Afcan Mining Limited and available at www.sedar.com under Afcan Mining Limited.).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Sino Gold Mining Limited
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Acquisition of Sino Gold
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	On December 15, 2009, the Company closed its acquisition of all of the outstanding securities (the &ldquo;Sino Gold Securities&rdquo;) of Sino Gold Mining Limited (&ldquo;Sino Gold&rdquo;) not then held by Eldorado, pursuant to a Scheme Implementation Deed with Sino Gold dated August 26, 2009, as amended October 27, 2009 (the &ldquo;Scheme Deed&rdquo;), by way of schemes of arrangement (the
	&ldquo;Schemes&rdquo;) under the laws of Australia (the &ldquo;Transaction&rdquo;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Pursuant to the Schemes, Eldorado, through its wholly owned subsidiary, Eldorado Pacific Pty Limited (&ldquo;Eldorado Pacific&rdquo;), acquired all of the outstanding ordinary shares of Sino Gold (the &ldquo;Sino Gold Shares&rdquo;) not held by Eldorado that, together with the Sino Gold Shares already then held by Eldorado, constituted 100% of the issued and outstanding Sino Gold Securities following the
	implementation of the Transaction. All outstanding options (&ldquo;Sino Gold Options&rdquo;) to purchase Sino Gold Shares were cancelled pursuant to the Schemes in connection with the implementation of the Transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Eldorado issued an aggregate of 131,772,777 Common Shares, either directly or indirectly as CHESS Depository Interests (&ldquo;CDIs&rdquo;), through CHESS Depository Nominees Pty Limited (&ldquo;CHESS&rdquo;) to former shareholders and optionholders of Sino Gold pursuant to the Scheme Deed in connection with the implementation of the Transaction. Consideration for the Sino Gold Shares acquired was Common
	Shares, with the number issued based on a share exchange ratio of 0.55 Common Share for each Sino Gold Share. Consideration for the cancellation of Sino Gold Options was Common Shares, with the number issued for each Sino Gold Option being calculated with reference to the share exchange ratio, the exercise price for such Sino Gold Option and whether the Sino Gold Option was &ldquo;in the money&rdquo; or not.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Eldorado previously acquired 57,968,029 Sino Gold Shares (which represented approximately 19.83% of the issued and outstanding Sino Gold Shares at the time of the closing of that acquisition), pursuant to a Share Purchase and Sale Agreement dated June&nbsp;3, 2009, as amended on July 10, 2009, (collectively the &ldquo;GFA SPA&rdquo;) with Gold Fields Australasia (BVI) Limited (&ldquo;GFA&rdquo;) in
	return for 27,824,654 Common Shares and a purchase price adjustment right. In connection with the implementation of the Transaction, Eldorado issued 4,057,762 Common Shares to GFA pursuant to the purchase price adjustment provisions of the GFA SPA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	A total of 135,830,539 Common Shares (including the 4,057,762 Common Shares issued to GFA) were issued in connection with the implementation of the Transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 25 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Business Acquisition Report regarding our acquisition of Sino Gold dated February 17, 2010 was filed on SEDAR and is available at www.sedar.com.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Through Sino Gold&rsquo;s subsidiaries, we own 82% of the Jinfeng Gold Mine in southern China&rsquo;s Guizhou Province, 95% of the White Mountain Gold Mine in northeast China&rsquo;s Jilin Province and 95% of the Eastern Dragon Gold Project in northern China&rsquo;s Heilongjiang Province as well as interests in other mineral properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Jinfeng
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Eldorado holds its interest in the Jinfeng Gold Mine indirectly through its wholly-owned subsidiary Sino Gold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Property Description and Ownership Interest
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng Gold Mine is an open-pit and underground mine located in the south-west region (Guizhou Province) of the People&rsquo;s Republic of China (&ldquo;PRC&rdquo;). The project area is approximately 180 km south-southwest of the provincial capital city Guiyan near Lannigou Village, 68 km south-east of Zhenfeng County centre, Qianxinan Prefecture.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Sino Guizhou Jinfeng Mining Limited (&ldquo;Sino&rdquo;) is the operator of the Jinfeng Gold Mine and is 82% owned by Sino Gold, with the remainder owned by Guizhou Lannigou Gold Mine Limited
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The mining license for the both open pit and underground mine was granted in May 2005 and is valid until May 2017 as shown in the table below. The Jinfeng mining license (the &ldquo;Jinfeng Licence&rdquo;) states that Sino is licensed to mine between 750m above sea level and 250m below sea level. An application must be made to mine outside of these levels. The Jinfeng Gold Operating Permit was issued on
	December 25, 2006 and is valid until December 25, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 5.4PT; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="624" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.75PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-LEFT: 5.75PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.15PT; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 2.15PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="72">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Mine
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.75PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-LEFT: 5.75PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.15PT; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-TOP: 2.15PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="120">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 12PT 0.5IN 0IN 1IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Mining License
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0IN 0IN 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	No.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.75PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-LEFT: 5.75PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.15PT; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-TOP: 2.15PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="106">

<B>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Mining Area
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0IN 0IN 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	(km2)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.75PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-LEFT: 5.75PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.15PT; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-TOP: 2.15PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="123">

</P>

</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.75PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-LEFT: 5.75PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.15PT; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-TOP: 2.15PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="96">

</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.75PT; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-LEFT: 5.75PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.15PT; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 2.15PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="72">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	May 2017
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The mining license allows full surface rights for access and mining of the deposit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Sino Gold&rsquo;s co-operative joint venture partner, Guizhou Lannigou Gold Mine Limited, is entitled to receive 3% of the net sales revenue of the gold produced each year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	A royalty is payable to Minsaco BIOX
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Pty Limited, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Gold Fields Limited, based on a dollar amount per ounce of gold produced in connection with the use of Minsaco&rsquo;s BIOX
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Process. The amount of the payments to be made under the BIOX
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	licence agreement are confidential and may not be disclosed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Location, Climate, Access and Infrastructure
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng Gold Mine is connected to the provincial road system by 12km of sealed access road. The road then reverts to 72km of unsealed road through a mountainous region before connecting to sealed roads and highways. The county is in the process of sealing the remaining 72km section of the access road. The main access road to the site and plant has been constructed as a &ldquo;Class 4&rdquo; road by
	the Provincial Government. The Provincial Government has responsibility for maintaining this road.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	There are four administrative villages in the Jinfeng area, Bai Ni Tian, Shi Zhu, Tinshan and Niluo, with populations ranging from 500 to 1200 people. The nearest large population centre is Lannigou village, which is approximately 1.6km from the Jinfeng Gold Mine and 1.9km from the flotation tailings storage facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Located in the subtropical humid monsoon zone, Guizhou Province enjoys a humid climate with hot summers and mild winters. Climatic conditions should allow the Jinfeng Gold Mine to operate all year, however, seasonal heavy rainfall may interrupt open-pit mining for several days per year. The average annual rainfall is 1,200mm, which falls primarily from May to August. The yearly average temperature is
	19&deg;C, ranging between 6&deg;C and 30&deg;C.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 26 -
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Electrical power supply to Jinfeng is via a 110kV electric power line connected to the provincial electrical grid that has been extended 42km from Zhenfeng. A 22 kilometre feeder line from Ceheng was constructed in 2008 and put into operation on April 25, 2009 to provide double 110KV power supply feed to Jinfeng. Water requirements are sourced from the Luofan River and pumped to the process plant via a
	3km pipeline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng site has established areas for tailings storage facility, waste storage and the plant site. All of these sites have been commissioned and are in use.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Geology and Mineralization
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng Mine area is located on the watershed between the Beipan River to the east and the Luofan River to the West.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	To the west of Jinfeng, where the lithology is predominantly Permian limestone, the topography is rugged and has features that are typical of karst. The range of elevation is from approximately 350 masl to nearly 1,150 masl. Sinkholes are common and are commonly very large. Surface water is somewhat intermittent within this terrain, with many water courses flowing in cave systems below surface. During
	the wet season, very large flows can develop in subterranean river systems.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The topography at the Jinfeng Mine site is not as rugged as it is within areas underlain by karst. There are, however, substantial topographic variations from about 400 masl to 760 masl with natural slopes ranging from 20&deg; to 35&deg;. The Jinfeng Mine area is underlain by Triassic sandstones, siltstones and mudstones.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng Gold Mine is an example of a Chinese Carlin-style gold deposit located at the north-eastern corner of the Laizhishan Dome within a district known as the Golden Triangle. Jinfeng is the largest known example of a Carlin-style gold deposit in the Golden Triangle area.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng deposit is hosted within, and immediately adjacent to, a series of interconnected major faults (known as F3, F2, F20, F7 and Rongban faults). The ore consists of disseminated pyrite, arsenical pyrite, and arsenopyrite which replace the shale and sandstone of the Middle Triassic Xuman Formation within the faults and in the immediately adjacent wall rocks. The gold occurs in the rims of
	fine-grained pyrite and arsenopyrite grains and is very finely distributed through the deposit. At Jinfeng, the mineralized zone is 900m in strike, 10 to 30m in width and has been explored on the F3 and F7 down to a depth of 900m vertically below surface.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng deposit can be divided into three major domains: (i) mineralization on the west-northwest trending F3 fault and at the intersection of the F3 fault with the F7 fault at depth (the F7 is not exposed at surface within the mine) which are the major features of the Huangchanggou part of the deposit at Jinfeng; (ii) mineralization associated with the F2 fault, which strikes orthogonally to the F3
	and forms the northern edge of the Huangchanggou deposit; and (iii) mineralization hosted by a number of narrower northwest trending faults at Rongban, separated from Huangchanggou by the F2 fault and largely related to the F12 fault.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng orebody is a structurally controlled gold deposit with some replacement style mineralization. The majority of the mineralization is hosted by the major east-southeast trending high-angle F3 fault, which is consistently mineralized over 1,300 m of strike and to a depth of more than 1,000 m.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The F3 fault is linked to a major low-angle thrust fault (F7). Northeast trending folds of the F3 fault and the intersection of the F3 and F7 faults have focused high-grade mineralization at depth, which plunges east-southeast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Within the deposit there is a strong correlation between gold and sulphur (in the form of sulphide). Mercury and antimony are introduced later than the gold-forming events, although there remains a spatial correlation between mercury, antimony and gold as a result of common controls by the major faults. The distribution of arsenic within the deposit is less well understood. High arsenic can occur without
	high gold, although high gold values will more commonly be associated with higher arsenic. Arsenic distribution is not directly proportional to gold because of the late overprint of mercury (orpiment and realgar mineralization) which does not contain gold but is associated with some of the arsenic mineralization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 27 -
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	History
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The initial discovery of Jinfeng occurred in the early 1980&rsquo;s by The No. 117 Team of Guizhou Metallurgical Design and Research Institute (&ldquo;117 Team&rdquo;) while following up on the source of a significant anomaly in a regional stream sediment survey. Subsequently, the 117 Team defined a gold deposit by mapping, surface trenching, development of a number of exploration adits and drilling.
	There are no reliable estimates of the amount of gold recovered from these workings. Since 2002, there has been further delineation of the resource incrementally adding to the size of the deposit. The history of the Jinfeng project from discovery to development is shown in the following table:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="631" BORDER="0">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Gold Operating Permit Granted
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	First Gold Poured
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Commercial Production Achieved
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Drilling, Sampling and Analysis and Data Verification
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Since acquisition of Jinfeng, Sino Gold has maintained an active drilling program aimed principally at (i) extending the identified resource down-plunge to the east-southeast, and (ii) infilling the resource to upgrade resource categorization as a basis for estimating ore reserves. The Jinfeng resource is open on 2 levels, extending down-plunge to the east-southeast, comprising an &ldquo;Upper
	Zone&rdquo; and a deeper &ldquo;High Grade Zone&rdquo;, situated approximately 400-500m and 800-900m below surface, respectively. In addition, the resource is open down-dip to the north-northeast, particularly at the western end of the deposit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The deepest drilling at Jinfeng has intercepted strong gold mineralization and intense alteration at more than 1,000 m in depth. This deep, down-plunge zone has now been followed to near the contact of the Triassic sediments and underlying Permian limestones, which is considered very prospective for gold deposition. Several gold deposits in China&rsquo;s Golden Triangle region are located in a similar
	stratigraphic position near the Triassic-Permian contact.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Testing for further down plunge extensions to the orebody is planned to resume in 2010, possibly from an underground drive. Sino Gold has a dominant tenement holding in the Jinfeng district via three joint ventures covering an extensive area of more than 300 km
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	around the Laizhisan Dome. Regional exploration during 2009 has consisted of reconnaissance soil sampling.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The logging geologists examine core samples and collect data regarding physical properties, stratigraphy, lithology, structure and texture of the rocks, as well as mineralization and alteration of the ore bearing intervals. The data are put on the template logging sheets using Jinfeng logging codes and then copied to the exploration data base. The logging geologist also marks sampling intervals and the
	cutting line on the core. The sample interval is 1.0 m long within an orebody which is visibly mineralized zone and an additional four samples in the hanging wall and footwall of the mineralized zone.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	After all logging procedures are completed, the core boxes with selected sampling intervals are transported to the cutting section of the preparation laboratory and, after splitting, all core boxes are stored in the exploration camp storage facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The primary laboratory assaying samples is the Northwest Geological Institute in Xi&rsquo;an, Shaanxi Province (&ldquo;Xi&rsquo;an Lab&rdquo;). Samples are accompanied by a sample dispatch sheet, which are checked to ensure that all samples are accounted for. Sample data is entered into the laboratory&rsquo;s databases, where replicates and laboratory standards are allocated. Insertion of duplicate and
	standard samples conforms to international standard practice to test the laboratory&rsquo;s procedures for accuracy and precision.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 28 -
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Results for the various samples are loaded into a database and the results emailed to the Jinfeng Data Administrator in the form of an Excel spreadsheet. The results spreadsheet is emailed to the head office of Sino Gold, where a separate database is maintained as a check on the master database. Duplicate assays are sent to an independent Australian laboratory, ALS-Chemex in Brisbane.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	SRK prepared a NI 43-101 compliant resource and reserve statement effective October 2007. In SRK&rsquo;s opinion, sampling and sample preparation procedures and practices at the Jinfeng site are adequate and generally concordant with internationally observed QA/QC protocols.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	SRK collected and selected check samples derived from cores, coarse rejects and pulps and dispatched them to assay laboratories for the purpose of independent checking of gold assays compared to previously obtained assay data. All of the data concerning those samples was copied from the Sino Gold exploration data base. Sino Gold was requested to provide control assays and to have these performed in an
	independent laboratory in Australia. The verification samples were relocated to the Intertek (Beijing) laboratory and assays for gold were completed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	SRK completed an analysis of the assay results from the Intertek laboratory compared to the original assays completed for Sino Gold at the Xi&rsquo;an Lab. The Jinfeng verification samples show some imprecision, with six values that were very different in the verification sample than the original assays; in addition, the verification samples have a lower grade at the upper end of the distribution than
	the original samples. However, the grade tenors of the original and verification samples are sufficiently similar to broadly confirm the results of the original sampling.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mineral Resource and Mineral Reserve Estimates
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	See &ldquo;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Description of Business &ndash; Summary Review &ndash; Mineral Reserves and Mineral Resources
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	&rdquo;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mining Operations
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Jinfeng uses standard tuck and shovel mining methods in the open-pit mine and cut and fill (&ldquo;CAF&rdquo;) methods in the underground mine. For the open pit mine, Jinfeng mines on 5 m benches for ore and 10m benches for bulk waste. In areas of narrow ore zones, Jinfeng selectively mines ore on 2.5 m benches. In the underground mine, Jinfeng uses narrow mining equipment in areas of orebody width as
	low as 2 m.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The process plant design is based on a metallurgical flow-sheet designed to optimise gold recovery and minimise the cost of production. The unit operations comprising the flow-sheet include primary crushing, SAG, ball milling, bulk flotation, thickening, biological leaching and neutralization, CIL gold dissolution, AARL elution and tailings detoxification. Tailings from flotation and leaching are
	impounded in separate storage facilities to avoid biocides returning to the process water circuit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Jinfeng ore is refractory in nature, with the majority of gold encapsulated in sulphide minerals. As such, the gold is not readily amenable to dissolution in a conventional CIL circuit. In order to extract gold at economic recovery rates, the Jinfeng gold processing plant was designed and constructed utilising BIOX
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	technology. The BIOX
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	technology destroys the sulphide
	minerals and exposes the gold for subsequent CIL processing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The prime criteria for the Jinfeng plant design was a capacity of 1,200,000 tonnes per annum of primary ore with a minimum feed sulphur grade of 1.7% and a maximum grade of 2.25%. This throughput is based on using the crushing plant for 3,285 hours per annum, the milling circuit for 8,000 hours per annum at an availability of 91.3%, and the BIOX
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, CCD, liquor neutralization, CIL and
	detoxification circuits for 8.320 hours per annum at an availability of 95%. The plant capacity has since been increased to 1,450,000 tonnes per year through various optimization and engineering projects. Budgeted recovery for 2010 is 86%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 29 -
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Environmental
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The issues and concerns identified by SRK that are considered to remain potential environmental risks, or may impact on the ability of Sino to operate the processing plant uninterrupted include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-CIL Tailings Facility Water Management
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-Waste Rock Characterization, Metal Leachability and Water Management Strategy
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-Co-disposal of process treatment solids with flotation tailings
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-Soil Balance and Closure
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The tailings have been shown to be net acid generating, the CIL tailings are expected to have a residual sulphide content of about 0.5 to 1 % (estimated acid generation potential of 15 to 30 kgH2SO4/tonne) with no neutralization buffering capacity since they have been acid leached. Extended exposure of the tailings, as proposed by the beach deposition strategy, could lead to the oxidation of the
	tailings, acidification and increase metal release to the pond.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	SRK comments that the appropriate mitigative measure would be sub-aqueous disposal, however, that may inhibit densification of the tailings, and, the larger pond that will form will affect the performance of the proposed treatment strategy. It is likely that an operational balance will need to be developed to maximise pond volume to limit oxidation of the tailings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The current waste rock management plan relies solely on segregation based on sulphur content to identify the potential for net acid generation. However, SRK mentions that no consideration appears to be given to metal leachability. The available geochemical assessment is based on a limited number of samples that may not adequately address the variability within the waste rock. It is further noted that the
	leachate concentrations obtained from the column leach tests were compared directly with water quality standards and no attempt was made to scale the leach rates to actual field conditions as they will be in the waste rock dump. In particular, the small scale waste rock column tests have shown a propensity to leach arsenic. Scaled to full scale the cumulative arsenic release rates may be significant and pose a significant environmental concern both during operations and after
	closure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The BIOX&reg; process generates an abundance of acidic solution with elevated metal concentrations including iron, arsenic and some base metals. The acidic water will be recovered in a counter current decant system and treated with lime to precipitate the dissolved metals as metal hydroxides and oxy-hydroxides and/or to sorb or co-precipitated some of the dissolved species. No testing has been undertaken
	to assess the long term stability of the solids that will be deposited in the flotation tailings impoundment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The rehabilitation and closure strategy remains conceptual in nature only. An inventory and management strategy for the pre-stripping and storage of the soils will be critical to the success of the proposed conceptual strategy and to achieve the land-use objectives after closure. It is also necessary to demonstrate through a soil inventory assessment that sufficient soil is available to complete the
	proposed closure strategy. Alternatively, suitable borrow sources will need to be identified that will be readily accessed and cost effective. While Sino indicated that soil will be available from the lower valley area below the waste rock dump to the Luofan River, access to the soil has not yet been negotiated. This land will however be compulsorily acquired by the applicable Chinese government agency during the dam fill stage of the Longtan hydroelectric scheme, which would suggest
	that Sino should have access to the soil.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Operating and Capital Costs
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Gold production commenced at Jinfeng in May 2007 with commercial production being achieved in September 2007.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Based on the Proved and Probable Ore Reserves only, 19.2 Mt as at December 2009 (minus the amount mined in 2009) , and a mining and processing rate of 1.45 Mt per annum or ore, Jinfeng has an indicative mine life for the combined open-pit and underground mines of 12 years. Initial mining of ore was from the Jinfeng open pit, with 0.7 Mt and 1.4 Mt of ore mined in 2007 and 2008 respectively. Ore is now
	being sourced concurrently from the open pit and the underground mine, with 1.3 Mt of ore mined in 2009. year In 2007, 2008 and 2009, Jinfeng produced 56,981 ounces of gold, 150,928 ounces of gold at a cash operating cost of US$400 per ounce and 168,828 ounces of gold at a cash operating cost of US$453 per ounce respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-&nbsp;30 -
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Development of the underground mine to supplement ore from the open pit mine has continued in 2009. The underground mine is now planned to contribute a total of approximately 400,000 tonnes of ore during 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Enterprises engaged in the mining of mineral resources in China must ordinarily pay a resource compensation fee. The fee is a tax deductible variable royalty levied by the Ministry of Land and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Resources and, in the case of Jinfeng, would equate to about US$27 per ounce of gold produced. However, Jinfeng was granted a five-year exemption from payment of the fee when Jinfeng was approved as an &ldquo;encouraged&rdquo; project in January 2005. This exemption expires in 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	In December 2008, Jinfeng received a notice from the Ministry of Land and Resources advising that the Ministry had concluded that Jinfeng should not receive an exemption from payment of the resource compensation fee. Jinfeng is of the view that it qualifies for the exemption. A formal application by Jinfeng for administrative review of the Ministry&rsquo;s notice has been accepted by the Ministry&rsquo;s
	Administrative Review Office and both Jinfeng and the Ministry have submitted papers in support of their positions. The Administrative Review Office recently adjourned the proceedings in order to conduct further investigations. In January 2010, the Ministry of Land and Resources issued a document to provincial and local officials advising the officials not to attempt to collect the resource compensation fee pending a final decision in the Administration Review. The timing and ultimate
	outcome of that review process remain uncertain.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	If Jinfeng&rsquo;s exemption is invalidated, its obligation to pay the resource compensation fee would be backdated to first gold production. Based on historical production, approximately US $10 million would be payable on production up to December 31, 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Current Exploration
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Exploration at Jinfeng is targeting the continuation of the deposit at depth to extend the known underground resource down-dip and down-plunge at the intersection of the F3 fault with the F7 fault, which plunges east-southeast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Three JF42 JV exploration licences have been consolidated into one joint venture as part of Jinfeng, surrounding the mining lease which is 82% held by Sino Gold. Since 2004, these exploration licences have been explored by Sino Gold for Carlin-style replacement gold mineralization similar to that at Jinfeng.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Exploration on the JF42 licences aims to identify additional resources which could add to the current Jinfeng project or become a stand alone operation. Exploration to date has not added to the original resource estimates. There remains potential for deeper targets which may have underground mining potential. Deeper targets may have a slightly different style of mineralization than that at Jinfeng. The
	structural models remain the same with intersections between northwest trending faults and northeast trending faults remaining the primary target. Further work will focus on the F7 fault at depth down dip of the main Jinfeng resource but off the Jinfeng License, the F3 fault to the southeast of the Jinfeng License and the F7 fault from Laowuji to Nilou and Gaolu.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Jinfeng Reports
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Jinfeng is the subject of the following technical report: &ldquo;Jinfeng Gold Mine, Guizhuo Province, China&rdquo; (effective date October 10, 2007), prepared for Sino Gold by SRK Consulting (Australasia) Pty Ltd. And dated January 29, 2010 (the &ldquo;Jinfeng Report&rdquo;). The qualified person responsible for preparation of the Jinfeng Report is Michael Warren, BSc.(Mining Eng.), MBA, FAusIMM, FAICD.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The scientific and technical information is largely derived from the Jinfeng Report. The Jinfeng Report is available at www.sedar.com under Eldorado&rsquo;s name, and should be reviewed to put the preceding discussion in context.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	White Mountain Mine
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Eldorado holds its interest in the White Mountain Gold Mine indirectly through its wholly-owned subsidiary Sino Gold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 31 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Property Description and Ownership Interest
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	White Mountain is located in Jilin Province approximately eight km from the city of Baishan and 230 km southeast of Changchun.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	White Mountain Gold Mine is owned by the White Mountain Chinese Joint Venture (&ldquo;CJV&rdquo;), in which Sino has a 95% interest through its wholly-owned subsidiary Sino Gold BMZ Mining Limited, with the remainder held by Tonghua Jilin Tonhua Institute of Geology and Minerals Exploration and Development, the CJV partner.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The White Mountain Gold Operating Permit was issued on February 20, 2008 and is valid until February 20, 2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	White Mountain has a mining certificate for 205.14ha valid from April 16, 2008 to April16, 2019. The gold operation permit for the mine was rechecked in 2010 and is passed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	White Mountain also has four exploration leases as noted in the table below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4PT; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 0IN; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="151">
