<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 6PT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="48">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="4">
<B>
	&bull;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 6PT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	potential loss of our key employees or the key employees of any business we acquire;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 6PT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="48">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="4">
<B>
	&bull;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 6PT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	unanticipated changes in business, industry or general economic conditions that affect the assumptions underlying the acquisition; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 6PT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="48">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="4">
<B>
	&bull;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 6PT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	decline in the value of acquired properties, companies or securities.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Any one or more of these factors or other risks could cause us not to realize the benefits anticipated to result from the acquisition of properties or companies, and could have a material adverse effect on our ability to grow and on our financial condition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We cannot give any assurance that we will successfully identify and complete an acquisition transaction and, if completed, that the business acquired will be successfully integrated into our operations.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	While we continue to seek acquisition opportunities consistent with our acquisition and growth strategy, we cannot be certain that we will be able to identify additional suitable acquisition candidates available for sale at reasonable prices, to consummate any acquisition or to integrate any acquired business into our operations successfully. Acquisitions may involve a number of special risks,
	circumstances or legal liabilities. These and other risks related to acquiring and operating acquired properties and companies could have a material adverse effect on our results of operations and financial condition. In addition, to acquire properties and companies, we would use available cash, incur debt, issue Common Shares or other securities, or a combination of any one or more of these. This could limit our flexibility to raise capital; to operate, explore and develop our
	properties; to make additional acquisitions; and could further dilute and decrease the trading price of the Common Shares. When evaluating an acquisition opportunity, we cannot be certain that we will have correctly identified and managed the risks and costs inherent in the business that we are acquiring.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	From time to time, we engage in discussions and activities with respect to possible acquisitions. At any given time, discussions and activities can be in process on a number of initiatives, each at a different stage of development. We can provide no assurance that any potential transaction will be successfully completed, and, if completed, that the business acquired will be successfully integrated into
	our operations. If we fail to manage our acquisition and growth strategy successfully, it could have a material adverse effect on our business, results of operations and financial condition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	There may be no right for shareholders to evaluate the merits or risks of any future acquisition undertaken by us.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	There may be no right for our shareholders to evaluate the merits or risks of any future acquisition undertaken by us except as required by applicable laws and stock exchange rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We may not realize the benefits we anticipated with the acquisition of Sino Gold due to challenges associated with integrating the operations, technologies and personnel of Sino Gold with ours.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The success of the Sino Gold acquisition will depend in large part on our success in integrating the operations, technologies and personnel of Eldorado and Sino Gold in a timely manner. There are risks that the integration between the businesses of Eldorado and Sino Gold may take longer than expected and that anticipated efficiencies and benefits of that integration may be less than estimated. These
	risks include possible differences in the management culture of the two groups and the potential loss of key personnel. In addition, the overall integration of the operations, technologies and personnel of Eldorado and Sino Gold may result in unanticipated operational problems, expenses, liabilities and diversion of management&rsquo;s attention. The failure to achieve such integration could result in the failure to realize any of the anticipated benefits of the acquisition and could
	impair our results of operations, profitability and financial results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage82"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-&nbsp;68 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As a consequence of the Sino Gold acquisition, we are subject to significant additional capital requirements associated with the expanded operations and expanded portfolio of development projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Risks Related to Our Common Shares
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Further equity issuances may substantially dilute the interests of our shareholder and may have an adverse effect on the market price of our securities.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We may require additional funds to fund our exploration and development programs and potential acquisitions. If we issue additional equity securities, such issuances may substantially dilute the interests of our shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Furthermore, future agreements may, and a number of our existing agreements do, provide for additional issuances of shares that may result in dilution to shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Issuances of substantial amounts of our securities, or the availability of such securities for sale, could adversely affect the prevailing market prices for our securities. A decline in the market prices of our securities could impair our ability to raise additional capital through the sale of securities should we desire to do so.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Common Shares may experience price and volume fluctuations.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	In recent years, the securities markets have experienced a high level of price and volume volatility, and the market price of securities of many companies has experienced wide fluctuations that have not necessarily been related to the operating performance, underlying asset values or prospects of such companies. There can be no assurance that such fluctuations will not affect the price of our securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	In the past, following periods of volatility in the market price of a company&rsquo;s securities, shareholders have often instituted class action securities litigation against those companies. Such litigation, if instituted, could result in substantial costs and diversion of management attention and resources, which could significantly harm our profitability and reputation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Shareholders that hold Common Shares through Chess Depository Receipts (&ldquo;CDI&rdquo;) may be subject to additional price and volume risks. The number of CDIs listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (&ldquo;ASX&rdquo;) is less than the number of Common Shares issued. It is therefore likely that the market for CDIs will be less liquid than the market for Common Shares trading on the Toronto Stock
	Exchange (&ldquo;TSX&rdquo;) and the New York Stock Exchange (&ldquo;NYSE&rdquo;). This may have the effect of reducing the volume of CDIs that can be bought and sold on ASX and the speed with which they can be bought and sold. This reduced liquidity may also result in CDIs trading at a discount to Common Shares on the TSX and NYSE. However, a holder of CDIs can convert their CDIs into Common Shares tradable on TSX and NYSE, should the holder wish to access the market in Common Shares
	on TSX and NYSE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We do not expect to pay dividends on our Common Shares in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As of the date hereof we have not paid cash dividends on the Common Shares. Although we may in the future give consideration to the payment of dividends, there is no certainty that cash dividends will be paid. As a result, a shareholder may have to rely on capital appreciation, if any, to earn a return on its investment in the Common Shares in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We follow corporate governance requirements of Canadian corporate and securities laws.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Non-Canadian residents holding the Common Shares (directly or indirectly through CDIs) should be aware that we follow the corporate governance requirements of applicable Canadian corporate and securities laws, which may differ from corporate governance requirements under laws applicable in their place of residence. In addition, although we substantially comply with the corporate governance guidelines of
	NYSE, we have obtained certain exemptions from NYSE in deference to Eldorado&rsquo;s home country jurisdiction corporate governance requirements. We have also obtained exemptions from certain
<FONT SIZE="2">
	ASX requirements. We may from time to time seek other relief from corporate governance and exchange requirements and securities law on specific transactions from NYSE, ASX and other regulators.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage83"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-&nbsp;69 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We may fail to achieve and maintain the adequacy of internal control over financial reporting as per the requirements of the
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Sarbanes-Oxley Act
</FONT>
</B>
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We have documented and tested during our most recently ended fiscal year, our internal control procedures in order to satisfy the requirements of Section 404 of the
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Sarbanes-Oxley Act
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	(&ldquo;SOX&rdquo;). SOX requires an annual assessment by management and an independent assessment by our independent auditors of the effectiveness of our internal control
	over financial reporting. We may fail to achieve and maintain the adequacy of our internal control over financial reporting as such standards are modified, supplemented or amended from time to time, and we may not be able to ensure that we can conclude on an ongoing basis that we have effective internal controls over financial reporting in accordance with Section 404 of SOX. Our failure to satisfy the requirements of Section 404 of SOX on an ongoing, timely basis could result in the
	loss of investor confidence in the reliability of our financial statements, which in turn could harm our business and negatively impact the trading price of the Common Shares or market value of our other securities. In addition, any failure to implement required new or improved controls, or difficulties encountered in their implementation, could harm our operating results or cause us to fail to meet our reporting obligations. There can be no assurance that we will be able to remediate
	material weaknesses, if any, identified in future periods, or maintain all of the controls necessary for continued compliance, and there can be no assurance that we will be able to retain sufficient skilled finance and accounting personnel, especially in light of the increased demand for such personnel among publicly traded companies. Our acquisition of Sino Gold and any future acquisitions of companies may provide us with challenges in implementing the required processes, procedures
	and controls in the acquired operations. Acquired companies may not have disclosure controls and procedures or internal control over financial reporting that are as thorough or effective as those required by securities laws currently applicable to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	No evaluation can provide complete assurance that our internal control over financial reporting will detect or uncover all failures of persons within us to disclose material information otherwise required to be reported. The effectiveness of our controls and procedures could also be limited by simple errors or faulty judgments. In addition, as we continue to expand, the challenges involved in
	implementing appropriate internal controls over financial reporting will increase and will require that we continue to improve our internal controls over financial reporting. Although we intend to devote substantial time and incur costs, as necessary, to ensure ongoing compliance, we cannot be certain that it will be successful in complying with Section 404 of SOX.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	If any of the foregoing events, or other risk factor events as described herein occurs, our business, financial condition or results of operations could likely suffer. In that event, the market price of our securities could decline and investors could lose all or part of their investment.
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<A NAME="EX99_1_HTM_TOC14">
</A>
	CAPITAL STRUCTURE
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Share Capital
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our authorized capital consists of an unlimited number of Common Shares and an unlimited number of convertible non-voting shares (&ldquo;Non-Voting Shares&rdquo;), of which, as of December 31, 2009, 537,136,235 Common Shares were issued and outstanding, and no Non-Voting Shares were issued and outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	All of the Common Shares rank equally as to voting rights; participation in a distribution of our assets on a liquidation, dissolution or winding-up, or other distribution of our assets for the purpose of winding up our affairs; and the entitlement to dividends. Distributions in the form of dividends, if any, will be set by the Board of Directors. For more information, see the section
	&ldquo;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Dividend Policy
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	&rdquo;. Holders of Common Shares are entitled to receive notice of all shareholder meetings and to attend and vote their shares at the meetings. Each Common Share carries with it the right to one vote.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	If Non-Voting Shares were outstanding, the holders of these shares would be entitled to participate equally with the holders of the Common Shares with respect to dividend payment; asset distribution resulting from a liquidation, dissolution or winding-up; or the distribution of our assets for the purpose of winding up our affairs. Holders of Non-Voting Shares are entitled to receive notice of and to attend
	all meetings of the shareholders, but (except as required by law) they are not entitled to vote at any such meeting. Our articles state that holders of Non-Voting Shares may not vote separately as a class but will have one vote for each share on a proposal to amend the articles to increase or decrease any maximum number of authorized Non-Voting Shares or increase any maximum number of authorized shares having rights or privileges equal or superior to the Non-Voting Shares;, effect an
	exchange, reclassification or cancellation of all or part of Non-Voting Shares; or create a new class of shares equal or superior to the Non-Voting Shares. Each issued Non-Voting Share may at any time be converted at the option of the holder into one Common Share, provided that no such conversion may occur, if on the date of the conversion and after giving effect to the conversion, the holder and its affiliates would beneficially own 40 percent or more of the issued and outstanding
	Common Shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage84"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-&nbsp;70 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	If Non-Voting Shares were outstanding, neither the Common Shares nor the Non-Voting Shares may be subdivided, consolidated, reclassified or otherwise changed unless at the same time the other class of shares is subdivided, consolidated, reclassified or otherwise changed in the same proportion and in the same manner. No stock dividend may be declared or paid in respect of either the Common Shares or the
	Non-Voting Shares unless the stock dividend is declared equally on both classes of shares. No rights offering may be made to holders of Common Shares or Non-Voting Shares unless the rights offering is made equally to all holders of both classes of shares. As a condition of our listing on the Australian Securities Exchange (&ldquo;ASX&rdquo;), we have agreed to not issue Non-Voting Shares without prior approval of the ASX.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Provisions as to the modifications, amendment or variation of the rights attached to our shares are contained in our articles and the CBCA. Generally speaking, substantive changes to the share capital require the approval of the shareholders by special resolution (at least two-thirds of the votes cast).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The following details the share capital structure as at February 28, 2010:
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Share Option Plans
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As of December 31, 2009 the Company had two incentive stock option plans (&ldquo;Plans&rdquo;) approved by the shareholders under which stock options (&ldquo;Options&rdquo;) can be granted to directors, officers, employees and consultants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Company&rsquo;s Employee Plan, as amended from time to time, was initially established in 1994. Employee Plan Options generally have a five-year term. Employee Plan Options vest at the discretion of the Board of Directors at the time an Option is granted, typically in three separate tranches over two years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Company&rsquo;s Directors and Officers Plan (&ldquo;D&amp;O Plan&rdquo;), as amended from time to time, was initially established in 2003. D&amp;O Plan Options generally have a five-year term. D&amp;O Plan Options vest at the discretion of the Board of Directors at the time an Option is granted, typically in three separate tranches over two years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	For a more detailed review of our Plans, please see our most recent Management Proxy Circular.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The share purchase options granted, exercised and cancelled from January 1, 2009 to December 31, 2009 are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<A NAME="EX99_1_HTM_TOC15">
</A>
	MARKET FOR SECURITIES
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our Common Shares are listed and posted for trading on the TSX under the symbol &ldquo;ELD&rdquo; and on the NYSE under the symbol &ldquo;EGO&rdquo;. Our Common Shares were listed on the TSX on October 23, 1993 and NYSE on October 20, 2009. Our Common Shares were previously listed on the NYSE AMEX from January 23, 2003 until October 20, 2009. Our CDIs were listed on the ASX on December 7, 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	The following sets out the price range and volumes of the Common Shares traded or quoted on the TSX on a monthly basis for each month of the most recently completed financial year:
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<A NAME="EX99_1_HTM_TOC16">
</A>
	DIVIDEND POLICY
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We have not paid dividends on common shares since incorporation. We anticipate using our cash resources to undertake exploration, development and expansion programs on our mineral properties and to acquire additional mineral resource properties, and will give consideration to dividends as the Company&rsquo;s financial condition and outlook continues to strengthen.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Company&rsquo;s articles and bylaws state that the Board is to consist of a minimum of three (3) and a maximum of twenty (20) directors. The number of directors has been fixed at eight (8).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	At each annual meeting of the Company&rsquo;s shareholders, the entire Board of Directors retires and directors are elected for the next term. Each director serves until the close of the next annual meeting or until his or her successor is elected or appointed, unless his or her office is earlier vacated in accordance with our articles or with the provisions of the CBCA. To meet CBCArequirements, at
	least 25 percent of the members of our Board of Directors must be resident Canadians.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The names and provinces of residence, offices held within the Company and principal occupations of the directors and executive officers of the Company are listed below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 72 -
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;

	Name and Province/State of Residence

<FONT SIZE="1">
	Approximate Number of Common Shares Beneficially Owned Directly or Indirectly or over which
</FONT>
</B>

<B>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Control or Direction
</FONT>
</B>
<BR>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	is Exercised
</FONT>
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	3)
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 3PT" VALIGN="TOP">

<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Member of the Corporate Governance &amp; Nominating Committee
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 3PT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="22">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	4)
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 3PT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	As of the date hereof, in the aggregate, our directors and executive officers beneficially own or controlled or directed, directly or indirectly, 520,600 Common Shares (representing .09% of the issued and outstanding Common Shares).
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Nine of Eldorado&rsquo;s directors have been directors since the last annual shareholders&rsquo; meeting of the Company. Two of Eldorado&rsquo;s directors were appointed in connection with the closing of Sino Gold Transaction. Each of the Director&rsquo;s terms will expire at the next annual shareholders meeting of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Cease Trade Orders, Bankruptcies, Penalties or Sanctions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	No director or executive officer of the Company is, or within ten years prior to the date of this AIF has been, a director, chief executive officer or chief financial officer of any company (including the Company) that, (i) was subject to a cease trade order, an order similar to a cease trade order or an order that denied the relevant company access to any exemption under securities legislation, that was
	in effect for a period of more than 30 consecutive days, that was issued while the director or executive officer was acting in the capacity as director, chief executive officer or chief financial officer; or (ii) was subject to a cease trade order, an order similar to a cease trade order or an order that denied the relevant company access to any exemption under securities legislation, that was in effect for a period of more than 30 consecutive days, that was issued after the director or
	executive officer ceased to be a director, chief&nbsp;
<FONT SIZE="2">
	executive officer or chief financial officer and which resulted from an event that occurred while that person was acting in the capacity as director, chief executive officer or chief financial officer.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 74 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	No director or executive officer of the Company, or to the Company&rsquo;s knowledge,a shareholder holding a sufficient number of securities of the Company to affect materially control of the Company, (i) is, or within ten years prior to the date hereof has been, a director or executive officer of any company (including the Company) that, while that person was acting in that capacity, or within a year of
	that person ceasing to act in that capacity, became bankrupt, made a proposal under any legislation relating to bankruptcy or insolvency or was subject to or instituted any proceedings, arrangement or compromise with creditors or had a receiver, receiver manager or trustee appointed to hold its assets; or (ii) has, within ten years prior to the date hereof, become bankrupt, made a proposal under any legislation relating to bankruptcy or insolvency, or become subject to or instituted any
	proceedings, arrangement or compromise with creditors, or had a receiver, receiver manager or trustee appointed to hold the assets of the director, executive officer or shareholder.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	No director or executive officer of the Company, or to the Company&rsquo;s knowledgea shareholder holding a sufficient number of securities of the Company to affect materially the control of the Company, has been subject to (i) any penalties or sanctions imposed by a court relating to securities legislation or by a securities regulatory authority or has entered into a settlement agreement with a
	securities regulatory authority; or (ii) any other penalties or sanctions imposed by a court or regulatory body that would likely be considered important to a reasonable investor in making an investment decision.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Conflicts of Interest
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	To the best of our knowledge, and other than disclosed in this AIF, there are no known existing or potential conflicts of interest between us or any of our directors or officers, except that certain of the directors and officers serve as directors and officers of other public companies and therefore it is possible that a conflict may arise between their duties as a director or officer of Eldorado and
	their duties as a director or officer of such other companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our directors and officers are aware of the existence of laws governing accountability of directors and officers for corporate opportunity and requiring disclosures by directors or officers in accordance with the CBCA and they are expected to govern themselves in respect thereof to the best of their ability in accordance with the obligations imposed upon them by law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Board takes appropriate measures to exercise independent judgment in considering transactions and agreements in respect of which a director or officer may have a material interest. Where appropriate, directors absent themselves from portions of Board and committee meetings to allow independent discussion of points in issue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<A NAME="EX99_1_HTM_TOC18">
</A>
	CORPORATE GOVERNANCE AND BOARD COMMITTEES
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our Board has adopted a written mandate in which it has explicitly assumed responsibility for the stewardship and overseeing the management of our business. Our Board carries out its mandate directly or through its committees described below. For further information on our corporate governance practices, see our website at www.eldoradogold.com.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Board has established three Committees of directors: the Compensation Committee, the Audit Committee, and the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Compensation Committee
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Compensation Committee is composed of five independent directors. The Compensation Committee develops, reviews and monitors director and executive compensation and policies. The Committee is responsible for annually reviewing the compensation of directors and officers, and making its recommendations to the Board. Terms of Reference for the Compensation Committee describe the
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Committee&rsquo;s responsibilities, powers and operations and are available on our website at www.eldoradogold.com or by contacting our Corporate Secretary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Compensation Committee is composed of the following directors:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Wayne D. Lenton, Chairman
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Robert R. Gilmore
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	John S. Auston
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Geoffrey A. Handley
</FONT>
</P>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Audit Committee
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Audit Committee is currently composed of five independent directors. The Audit Committee is responsible for overseeing financial reporting, internal controls and public disclosure documents, as well as recommending the appointment of our external auditors, reviewing the annual audit plan and auditor compensation, approving non-audit services provided by the external auditor, reviewing hiring policies
	regarding former staff and auditors and evaluating our risk management procedures/systems.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage89"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 75 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The Audit Committee has adopted a Terms of Reference that reflects these and other responsibilities. The Terms of Reference require, amongst other things, the Committee&rsquo;s pre-approval of audit, audit-related, tax and non-audit services to be provided by Eldorado&rsquo;s auditors. The Terms of Reference for the Audit Committee, attached as Schedule A to this AIF, were approved by the Audit Committee
	and the Board of Directors on March 30, 2010 and are available on our website at www.eldoradogold.com or by contacting our Corporate Secretary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Reliance on Certain Exemptions
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	At no time since the commencement of the Company&rsquo;s most recently completed financial year has the Company relied on the exemptions in Section 2.4 of NI 52-110 (De Minimis Non-audit Services), Section 3.2 of NI 52-110 (Initial Public Offerings), Section 3.4 of NI 52-110 (Events Outside of Control of Member), Section 3.5 of NI 52-110 (Death, Disability or Resignation of Audit Committee Member),
	Section 3.3(2) of NI 52-110 (Controlled Companies), Section 3.6 (Temporary Exemption for Limited and Exceptional Circumstances), Section 3.8 (Acquisition of Financial Literacy) or an exemption from NI 52-110, in whole or in part, granted under Part 8 of NI 52-110.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	In 2005, our Audit Committee determined that non-audit services would no longer be performed by the Company&rsquo;s external auditors, without pre-approval of the Audit Committee, and management has established agreements with other service providers for such non-audit services.
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<A NAME="EX99_1_HTM_TOC19">
</A>
	LEGAL PROCEEDINGS AND REGULATORY ACTIONS
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Other than has been disclosed in this AIF
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	,
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	we are not aware of any material legal proceedings to which we are a party or to which our property is subject, nor are we aware that any such proceedings are contemplated. During the last financial year, we have not been subject to any penalties or sanctions imposed by a regulatory body in respect of securities
	legislation or regulatory requirements. We have not entered into any settlement agreement in respect of securities legislation or regulatory requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Furthermore, there are no (a) penalties or sanctions imposed against the Company by a court relating to securities legislation or by a securities regulatory authority during its most recently completed financial year; (b)&nbsp;other penalties or sanctions imposed by a court or regulatory body against the Company that would likely be considered important to a reasonable investor in making an investment
	decision in the Company; and (c)&nbsp;settlement agreements the Company entered into before a court relating to securities legislation or with a securities regulatory authority during its most recently completed financial year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<A NAME="EX99_1_HTM_TOC20">
</A>
	INTEREST OF MANAGEMENT AND OTHERS IN MATERIAL TRANSACTIONS
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Other than has been disclosed in this AIF or our annual MD&amp;A, we are not aware of any material interest, either direct or indirect, of (i) any of our or our subsidiaries&rsquo; directors or executive officers, (ii)&nbsp;a person that beneficially owns or directs, directly or indirectly more than 10% of our voting securities, or (iii) any associate or affiliate of any of the foregoing, in any
	transaction that has been entered into within our three most recent completed financial years or during the current financial year that has materially affected or will materially affect us.
</FONT>
</P>

	South NSW 2000.

	To the knowledge of the Company, none of the persons referred to above and none of the corporations or other entities by which they are employed have received or will receive any direct or indirect interests in the property of the Company or of an associated party or an affiliate of the Company or have any beneficial ownership, direct or indirect, of securities of the Company or of an associated party or
	an affiliate of the Company. Please refer to the information in the sections &ldquo;

	additional financial information is provided in our comparative Financial Statements and MD&amp;A in respect of the year ended December 31, 2009. <P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 11PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The following is a glossary of technical terms that may be found in this document and in the documents incorporated by reference:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="624" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	adit
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A passage driven horizontally into a mountainside to provide access to a mineral deposit from the surface of the working of a mine.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	adsorption
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The attachment of one substance to the surface of another.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	andesitic
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A rock condition where andesite, an igneous rock that has a silica content of approximately 60 percent, is present.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	argillic
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	An alteration characterized by quartz clay mix chloride.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	arsenopyrite
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A whitish to steel gray coloured arsenian mineral (FeAsS).
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Au
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Gold.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Australasian Code
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The Australasian Code for Reporting of Identified Mineral Resources and Ore Reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	autoclave
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The equipment used in an oxidation process in which high temperatures and pressures are applied to convert refractory sulphide mineralization into amenable oxide ore.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	autogenous grinding
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Grinding ore without the use of media such as steel balls or rods.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	back fill
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Waste material used to fill and support the void created by mining an ore body.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	banded iron
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	formation
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A rock formation that shows pronounced banding of iron-rich minerals and fine-grained quartz. Where mineralized, the formation contains sulphide and carbonate mineral.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	calcareous
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A substance that contains calcium carbonate.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	CIL
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Carbon in leach. CIL is a recovery process in which a slurry of gold ore, carbon granules and cyanide are mixed together. The cyanide dissolves the gold, which is then adsorbed on the carbon. The carbon is subsequently separated from the slurry, and the gold removed from the carbon.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	classified tailings
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Tailings material (sub-economic ground residue from mineral processing operations) that has been processed to remove fine-grained solids to promote free drainage of water. Commonly used as underground fill material.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	continued
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A corporation formed under laws other than the federal laws of Canada may apply to be &ldquo;continued&rdquo; under the federal
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Canada Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	(the &ldquo;CBCA&rdquo;) by applying for a certificate of continuance from the Corporations Directorate. Once the certificate is issued, the CBCA applies to the corporation as if the corporation was incorporated under the CBCA.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	crushing plant
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A plant in which run-of-mine ore is reduced in size by mechanical crushing to improve the liberation of gold particles for downstream recovery.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	crosscuts
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	An underground working or tunnel that is perpendicular to the trend of the rock layering.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Cu
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Copper.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	cut and fill
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A method of stoping in which ore is removed in slices (or lifts) and then the excavation is filled with rock or other waste material known as back fill, before the subsequent slice is mined.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	cyanidation
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The process of extracting gold or silver through dissolution in a weak solution of sodium cyanide.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	decline
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	An underground passageway connecting one or more levels in a mine and providing adequate traction for heavy, self-propelled equipment. These underground openings are often driven in a downward spiral, much the same as a spiral staircase.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	dextral faults
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Faults whose apparent direction of relative movement to each side is towards the right.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	-&nbsp;79 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="624" BORDER="0">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_27"></A>
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	diamond drill
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	(&ldquo;DDH&rdquo;)
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A type of rotary drill in which the cutting is done by abrasion rather than percussion. The cutting bit is set with diamonds and is attached to the end of long hollow rods through which water is pumped to the cutting face. The drill cuts a core of rock that is recovered in long cylindrical sections, an inch or more in diameter.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	diorites
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A light to dark coloured, crystalline intrusive igneous rock, composed of calcium, sodium and iron-bearing alumino-silicate minerals.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	dilution
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Waste material not separated from mined ore that was below the calculated economic cut-off grade of the deposit. Dilution results in increased tonnage mined and reduced overall grade of the ore.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	dip
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The angle that a geological structure forms with a horizontal surface, measured perpendicular to the strike of the structure.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	dor&eacute;
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Unrefined gold and silver in bullion form.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	electrostatic
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	precipitator
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A device or technology that recovers airborne particular matter.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	fault
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A surface or zone of rock fracture along which there has been displacement, from a few centimeters to a few kilometers in scale.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	feeder zones
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A channelway in a rock through which mineral-bearing and/or metal-bearing solutions or gases likely moved.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	fire assay
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A type of analytical procedure that involves the heat of a furnace and a fluxing agent to fuse a sample to collect any precious metals (such as gold) in the sample. The collected material is then analyzed for gold or other precious metals by weight or spectroscopic methods.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	float sulphide
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	concentrate
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A byproduct of the flotation process containing primary metals.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	flotation
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A process by which some mineral particles are induced to become attached to bubbles and float, and other particles to sink, so that the valuable minerals are concentrated and separated from the host rock.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	foliation
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A parallel orientation of platy minerals or mineral banding in rocks. Most common in metamorphic rocks.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	gabbro
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A dark coloured, crystalline intrusive igneous rock, composed principally of the calcium, iron and magnesium bearing alumino-silicate minerals.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	gangue
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Minerals that are sub-economic to recover as ore.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	grade
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The weight of precious metals in each tonne of ore.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	g
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Grams.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	g/t
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Grams of gold per metric tonne.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	ha
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Hectare.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	heap leaching
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The process of stacking ore in a heap on an impermeable pad and percolating a solution through the ore that contains a leaching agent such as cyanide. The gold that leaches from the ore into the solution is recovered from the solution by carbon absorption or precipitation. After adding the leaching agent, the solution is then recycled to the heap to effect further leaching.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	host rock
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	The body of rock in which mineralization of economic interest occurs.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	HQ
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Denotes the specific diameter of core in diamond drill.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	IP
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Induced polarization, a method of ground geophysical surveying using an electrical current to determine indications of mineralization.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	isoclinal
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Refers to a folded rock, in which two adjacent limbs are parallel.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	km
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Kilometre.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	km
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Square kilometres.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	km/h
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Kilometres per hour.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	leach
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Gold being dissolved in cyanide solution in heap leaching or in tanks in a processing plant (agitated leach, carbon in pulp, carbon in leach).
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	LOM
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	Life of mine.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="157">
<P>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	long hole open stope
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0.05IN; PADDING-TOP: 0.05IN" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="467">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
	A method of mining that involves drilling holes (typically up to 30 meters long) into an ore body and then blasting a slice of rock that falls into an open space. The broken ore is extracted and the resulting open chamber is not filled with supporting material.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX">

<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE HEADER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	- 80 -

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	&nbsp;
